profileText: A Senator from Michigan; born in Spencer, Tioga County, N.Y., January 6, 1853; attended the academies of Spencer, Candor, and Oswego, N.Y., the Oswego Normal Training School 1870-1873, and the medical department of the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor in 1873 and 1874; principal and superintendant of various schools in Illinois 1874-1884; settled in Big Rapids, Mich., where he established the Ferris Industrial School in 1884 and served as president until his death; president of the Big Rapids Savings Bank; unsuccessful Democratic candidate for election in 1892 to the Fifty-third Congress and for Governor of Michigan in 1904; Governor of Michigan 1913-1916; unsuccessful candidate for Governor in 1920; elected as a Democrat to the United States Senate in 1922 and served from March 4, 1923, until his death in Washington, D.C., March 23, 1928; interment in Highland View Cemetery, Big Rapids, Mich.

researchRecord.name: 1912-1940. 100 items and 8 volumes. Political and family correspondence, scrapbooks of political career, and manuscript autobiography.

Miscellaneous correspondence and photographs in various collections including Arthur Hendrick Vandenberg papers, 1884-1974; Chase Salmon Osborn papers, 1889-1949; Jabez Thomas Sunderland papers, 1868-1936; Jesse Siddall Reeves papers, 1853-1942; Roy C. Vandercook papers, 1900-1957; Rebecca Shelley papers, 1890-1984; Earl C. Michener papers, 1898-1934 and 1940-1954; Nisbett family papers, 1892-1923; Henry Romaine Pattengill papers, 1861-1939; Edith Cushway Munger papers, 1907-1945; William Butts Mershon papers, 1848-1943; Clarence Cook Little papers, 1924-1929; Harry Burns Hutchins papers, 1879-1930; Emil Lorch papers, 1891-1963; James Burrill Angell papers, 1845-1916; Roy Dikeman Chapin papers, 1886-1937; James W. Helme papers, 1844-1928; Lucius Lee Hubbard papers, 1871-1935; Wilbert B. Hinsdale papers, 1895-1934; Fred Dustin papers, 1886-1957; Marion LeRoy Burton papers, 1901-1925; Junius Emery Beal papers, 1882-1946; Arthur J. Lacy papers, 1891-1975; Sligh family papers, 1842-1967; Roy Wood Sellare papers, 1914-1946; Rice Aner Beal papers, 1843-1883; Blake family papers, ca. 1872-1920; and Herbert F. Baker papers, 1904-1926. Finding aid.
Discussed in interview with Edwin Chamberlin (1960) concerning dental legislation in Michigan. 15 pages.
1 letter (1913) in the William Carpenter papers; and 24 items on the 1913 Copper Strike in Michigan in the Roy Vandercook papers.
1891-1899. Ca. 860 items. Correspondence relating to the administration of Ferris Institute, and concerning Ferris' views on education, politics, religion, and other subjects. Finding aid.
